1.text: The beginning of the Good News of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

2.text: As it is written in the prophets:  Behold, I send my messenger before your face,   who will prepare your way before you.

3.text: The voice of one crying in the wilderness:   ‘Make ready the way of the Lord!   Make his paths straight!’

4.text: John came baptizing in the wilderness and preaching the baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.

5.text: All the country of Judea and those from Jerusalem went out to him. They were all baptized by John in the Jordan river, confessing their sins.

6.text: John was clothed with camel’s hair, and a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.

7.text: He preached, saying, “He who comes after me is more powerful than I, and I am not worthy to kneel down and untie the strap of his sandals.

8.text: I baptized you in water, but he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.”

9.text: It happened, in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and he was baptized by John in the Jordan.

10.text: Immediately coming up from the water, he saw the heavens torn open and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.

11.text: A voice came out of the heavens, “You are my beloved Son. In you I am well pleased.”

12.text: At once, the Spirit drove him out into the desert.

13.text: He was there, in the desert for forty days, being tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals and the angels were ministering to him.

14.text: Now after John had been arrested, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom of God,

15.text: and saying, “The time is fulfilled! The Kingdom of God is at hand! Repent and believe in the Good News.”

16.text: As he walked by the sea of Galilee, Jesus saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.

17.text: Jesus said to them, “Come after me, and I will make you fishers of men.”

18.text: Immediately, they left their nets and followed him.

19.text: Going on a little farther from there, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, who were also in a boat, mending the nets.

20.text: At once, he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired servants, and they began to follow him.

21.text: They went into Capernaum, and on the Sabbath day, Jesus entered into the synagogue and taught.

22.text: The people were astonished at his teaching because he taught them as having authority, not like the scribes.

23.text: And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit who cried out,

24.text: “Away! What do we have to do with you, Jesus, you Nazarene? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are: the Holy One of God!”

25.text: Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet, and come out of him!”

26.text: The unclean spirit, convulsing the man and crying with a loud voice, came out of him.

27.text: The people were all so amazed that they asked each other, “What is this? A new teaching? For with authority he commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him!”

28.text: The news about him went out immediately everywhere into the entire region of Galilee and its surrounding area.

29.text: As soon as they left the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, [along] with James and John.

30.text: Now Simon’s mother-in-law lay sick with a fever, and immediately, they told him about her.

31.text: Jesus came, took her by the hand, and raised her up. The fever left her and she began to serve them.

32.text: At evening, when the sun had set, they brought him all who were sick or possessed by demons.

33.text: The entire city was gathered at the door.

34.text: He healed many who were afflicted with various diseases and cast out many demons. However, he did not allow the demons to speak because they knew him to be the Christ.

35.text: Early in the morning, while it was still dark, Jesus arose, left the house, went out into a deserted place and prayed there.

36.text: Simon and those with him followed Jesus.

37.text: When they found him, they told him, “Everyone is looking for you!”

38.text: He replied, “Let us go into the next towns, so that I may preach there also, for this is why I came.”

39.text: And he was preaching in their synagogues throughout all of Galilee, casting out demons.

40.text: A leper came to him, begging him, kneeling down before him, and saying, “If you want to, you can make me clean!”

41.text: Being moved with compassion, Jesus stretched out his hand, touched the man, and said to him, “I want to! Be made clean.”

42.text: When Jesus said this, the leprosy immediately departed from the leper and he was made clean.

43.text: Jesus strictly warned him, and sent him out at once,

44.text: saying, “See that you do not say anything to anyone, but go and show yourself to the priest. Offer for your cleansing what Moses instructed, as a testimony to them.”

45.text: However, the man went off and began to proclaim it freely and to spread news about this matter, so that Jesus could no longer enter into a city openly. Instead, he remained outside in deserted places and people came to him from everywhere.
